heisigStory: Footprints that follow one another a few at a time indicate walking.
koohiiStory1: When walking your pet, you must stop a few times along the way when nature calls.
koohiiStory2: When you learn to walk, you take your steps a few at a time. Picture a clumsy but happy toddler who falls every few steps but keeps getting up to try again.
myStory: đi bộ. ít dừng lại là đi bộ
readingExamples: 歩道 (ほどう), 徒歩 (とほ), 進歩 (しんぽ), 歩合 (ぶあい), 日歩 (ひぶ), 歩む (あゆ.む), 歩く (ある.く)
words:
歩み(あゆみ): walking
歩む(あゆむ): to walk, to go on foot
譲歩(じょうほ): concession, conciliation, compromise
徒歩(とほ): walking, going on foot
歩(ふ): pawn (in chess or shogi)
進歩(しんぽ): progress, development
歩道(ほどう): footpath, walkway, sidewalk
歩く(あるく): to walk
散歩(さんぽ): walk, stroll
